intro: Anchusa velenovskyi var. stojanovii, commonly known as the Stojanovii Anchusa, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue to purple flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. It is a perennial species with a compact growth habit, often reaching heights of up to 30 cm. Its ornamental value makes it a desirable plant for rock gardens and dry landscape designs.
